steps.title: Open Chrome on your Mac.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your Mac. You’ll usually find it in the Applications folder.

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It’s near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Advanced.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Advanced . It’s near the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Open proxy settings.
steps.content: Click Open proxy settings . It’s under the “System” header. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Proxies tab.
steps.content: Click the Proxies tab. It’s near the top of the window.

steps.title: Remove the check marks from every option under “Select a protocol to configure.”
steps.content: Remove the check marks from every option under “Select a protocol to configure.” To disable all proxy settings, all of these boxes should be blank.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . Your Chrome proxy settings are now disabled.

steps.title: Open Chrome on your PC.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your PC. You’ll find it in the All Apps area of the Start menu.

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It’s near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Advanced.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Advanced . It’s near the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Open proxy settings.
steps.content: Click Open proxy settings . It’s under the “System” header.

steps.title: Click LAN settings.
steps.content: Click LAN settings . It’s the button at the bottom of the Connections tab, which opened by default.

steps.title: Remove the check mark from “Automatically detect settings.”
steps.content: Remove the check mark from “Automatically detect settings.”

steps.title: Remove the check mark from “Use a proxy server for your LAN.”
steps.content: Remove the check mark from “Use a proxy server for your LAN.”

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK .

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . The proxy settings are now disabled.

steps.title: Open Safari on your Mac.
steps.content: Open Safari on your Mac. It’s the compass icon typically found on the Dock.

steps.title: Click the Safari menu.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu. It’s near the top-left corner of the screen in the menu bar.

steps.title: Click Preferences….
steps.content: Click Preferences… .

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . It’s the icon with the gear near the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Change Settings….
steps.content: Click Change Settings… . It’s next to “Proxies” near the bottom of the window. This brings you to the Proxies tab of your network preferences. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove all check marks on the screen.
steps.content: Remove all check marks on the screen. This ensures that no proxies are enabled.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . All proxies are now disabled in Safari.

steps.title: Open Edge on your PC.
steps.content: Open Edge on your PC. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It’s at the top-right corner of Edge.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It’s at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click View advanced settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click View advanced settings . It’s under the “Advanced settings” header near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Open proxy settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Open proxy settings . It’s under the “Proxy setup” header.

steps.title: Slide “Automatically detect settings” to Off .
steps.content: Slide “Automatically detect settings” to Off . It’s under the “Automatic proxy setup” header.

steps.title: Slide “Use a proxy server” to Off .
steps.content: Slide “Use a proxy server” to Off . It’s under the “Manual proxy setup” header. The proxy settings for Edge are now disabled.
